body.name: Travelpro Maxlite Air Hardside Expandable Carry on Luggage, 8 Spinner Wheels, Lightweight Hard Shell Polycarbonate Suitcase, Black, Checked Large 28-Inch
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 23 hrs 16 mins
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 18 hrs 1 min
features: Check in size luggage complies with published check-in size restrictions for nearly all major domestic airlines (62 linear inches). 8 Spinner wheels rotate 360°, providing superior maneuverability and a smooth glide in every direction.
Hard shell suitcase has low profile top and side carry handles along with bottom grip provide multiple carrying options. Roomy main compartment expands 2” to maximize packing capacity when needed.

Check in hardside luggage has lightweight, 100% Polycarbonate hard shell that is engineered for impact-absorbing flexibility with a stylish outer finish that helps reduce visible scratches and scuffs. Built-in lock allows TSA authorities to safely unlock and relock the bag for inspection when needed (default code set at 0-0-0).

Hard shell luggage has interior zippered divider panels and accessory pocket keep contents organized, separated, and secure while the interior lining with H20 guard is made of 100% post-consumer recycled plastic bottles to help reduce environmental waste.

Overall Dimensions (includes wheels and handles): H: 30.5 in. W: 19.5 in. D: 12 in.; Case Dimensions: H: 27.5 in. W: 18.5 in. D: 12 in.; Weight: 10.1 lbs. Durable hard case luggage backed by Limited Lifetime Coverage plus trusted companion promise, which covers the cost of repair for damage from airline or other common carrier for 1 year. Applicable when purchased as new and after registration.
body.description: Finally, worry-free check-in is yours with the ultra-resilient, durable, well-equipped Maxlite® Air Large Check in Expandable Spinner Hardside Suitcase. This 29 inch luggage with spinner wheels is perfectly sized for longer trips or multiple people. 62 inch suitcase complies with published check-in size restrictions for nearly all major domestic airlines. The 100% polycarbonate exterior of this checked bag is engineered to flex on contact to prevent splitting, cracking or punctures, while a stylish exterior finish reduces visible scratches or scuffs on this hard luggage. A built-in TSA-lock allows authorities to safely unlock and relock the light pink suitcase for inspection when needed, and a zippered expansion option further maximizes packing capacity when needed. The interior lining of this large travel suitcase with wheels is made from 100% post-consumer recycled plastic bottles to help reduce environmental waste and treated with H2O guard for moisture resistance. Two zippered interior divider panels with multiple accessory pockets keep your packed contents organized, separated, and secure. Roll with ease on eight smooth-gliding spinner wheels that rotate 360° led by a PowerScope Lite extension handle that locks in two positions (38” and 42.5”) for users of different heights. A patented Contour Grip with rubberized touch points makes maneuvering easy and comfortable. This large hardside spinner luggage is backed by our Built For a Lifetime Limited Warranty with Trusted Companion Promise that even covers damage caused by airlines or other common carriers for the first year of the lifetime warranty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best for me
reviews.reviewText: I like the way this suitcase handles; it is lightweight, and it looks good. The lock is conveniently located and easy to set up. It's not a high-security thing, but it keeps the case closed. The Travelpro brand was marked discreetly on the front. I also ordered a different brand suitcase that was a little cheaper and had a slightly better rating, but it had the lock on the top by the handle, which is not convenient when opening the suitcase for unpacking. It also had its brand name in big letters across the front where no one could miss it. I do not mind branding on things, but this was overboard. It made the whole thing look cheesy (in my opinion). The Travelpro did well on its first trip. I like it. The other one went back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thought I would try hard side luggage
reviews.reviewText: I purchased both the 21 and 28-inch sizes. The 28-inch is huge! I like the way it loads w/ almost equal sides because it seems to balance and handle better. It glides well w/ 8 wheels and I love the color I chose. My only concern is the fact that there are only two handles on the entire bag making it difficult to lift, move and grab off the luggage turnstile. My husband had to grab the bag by the wheels to get a hold of it and retrieve it before it went around again! I love the sleekness of the bag. I guess I need to get used to the fact that there are no outside pockets. I loaded the bag on the floor for my return trip and found it difficult to reach the top because it is so large. But on the plus side, I was able to pack clothes for a week long trip, all toiletries, extra shoes, my pillow, a stuffable winter coat and a few books! All in all I am very happy w/ this set. Will purchase the medium size for a trip to Europe because I believe the 28-inch will not be easily manageable for a 70+ senior.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great traveling companion
reviews.reviewText: I used this new carry-on during a recent week-long trip. It rolled easily in any direction on all surfaces with a handle that is very comfortable to use.The interior had plenty of room with zippers that functioned well. The exterior zippers were easy to use as well.The suitcase came with clear instructions on how to change the combination of the lock, so again, this was easy to do.All in all, I had a pleasant experience with this unit case, and look forward to using it far into the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great bag, one flaw, but (eventually!) excellent customer service to make it right!
reviews.reviewText: I don't have much to add to L. Belanger's excellent review above.The bag itself is a dream to use - well made, swivels or can be tipped up to use on just 2 wheels and works flawlessly either way. There is plenty of space, and I really appreciate the way the expansion section is designed as it adds significant cubic inches to the overall capacity without compromising the bag's ability to fit in an overhead bin.However ... the cheap plastic wheels are of very poor quality and will degrade, especially if you take this overseas anywhere where the airport flooring isn't polished tile or concrete. Literally 2 days after my 1 year warranty had expired I took a trip to SE Asia and returned home with the above flat spot now worn into the wheels, a consequence of one of them getting stuck and dragged (unbeknownst to me) for a day or two."No worries," I thought, "I'll just order a replacement set of wheels. It'll cost me $20 for $2 worth of rubber, but I'm happy to do that to keep a $150 bag on the road."So I started to search for replacement wheels. No dice. No one on Amazon sells them, though there are MANY different versions that are almost the same thing (almost meaning useless in this context, as if it won't screw into the same holes, you can't use it). So I wrote Travelpro, asking where I could buy one from them. I was happy to overpay, again, as I didn't want to throw the bag in the garbage and all it needed was a simple replacement (which no specialized mechanical knowledge was required for - it's literally just unscrewing 5 screws).They insisted I take it to their repair center over an hour away. I refused, knowing that I was past the warranty deadline and would be charged for the repair, which would likely cost most of the price of just buying a new one. After several emails were exchanged, they asked for my address - I assumed I had won and they were going to send me a new wheel assembly!A few days later, a suspiciously large package arrived - it turns out they sent me a whole new bag, free of charge, despite me being out of warranty! So, amazing customer service, I have to say, in the end. They definitely made it right. Now if only I could figure out what to do with the other bag - I still don't want to throw it away!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Customer Service is the Worst!! DO NOT BUY!!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased 2 pieces of Travelpro Luggage. I was so thrilled with it and the ease of how it rolled. Unfortunately on my very first trip, the airlines broke the wheel. Since that is not considered under warranty, I tried contacting Travelpro to get replacement wheels at my expense. The website says to create a claim ticket as if iI have a warranty problem. I tried to create a claim ticket on line, but it would not accept my picture of the problem therefore no ticket # is issued. I tried the Live Chat and after 30 minutes, it referred me back to create a ticket # as they could not help without a ticket #. I sat on hold for 35 minutes, before an automated message told me again to go to the website. I even tried a local TravelPro dealer, but since I ordered this through Amazon, she could not help. I just want to order the wheels, but there is no place to get them; therefore I am stuck with a piece of luggage that has 3 wheels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality product, look great.
reviews.reviewText: Bought 3 sizes, best luggage set I ever owned.Nice light weight, and design makes them just right for packing and handling. Wish I'd found them sooner. Our new favorites for all traveling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love the color and the zippered compartments inside. It would have been nice to have straps to secure things as well but I use packing cubes anyway so not a deal breaker. I ordered one that was "like new" and the only thing I found was one wheel was slightly scuffed but for the price not a deal breaker, besides the airlines/airports will do worse. Overall great bag for the money and will fit nicely in the overhead bins, I would definitely recommend this brand.

Beautiful colour, smooth wheels, pretty light but sturdy! Went to the airport to check it with the cage carry-on sizer, it fits well with a little room to spare. If you're looking for an Air Canada approved carry-on, this is the one. I haven't really take it to fly yet, so I'll be back in a few months if anything happens.
Me llego mas pequeña de lo mencionado, se siente frágil y de mala calidad, no trae cinturones de sujeción por dentro. Mucho dinero por tan poco.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Quality, Crisp Looking, & Perfect Size for Carry-On Only Travel!
reviews.reviewText: Purchased my 21” Maxlite Air specifically to make the switch to Carry-On Only air travel. Had just returned from nearly 3 weeks in France and due to airline chaos in summer 2022 we went carry on only. My wife had a small roller but I had 40L Patagonia Black Hole Duffel which was great but a pain to lug through airports.The Maxlite gives me the same capacity, in a very lightweight hard sided 4-wheel roller. Super high quality and bang for your buck, consistent with all the reviews I had read. Also gives the option to expand it 2” in depth if you wanted to do some shopping and then check the bag on way home. I’ll update my review after our next trip this fall but it is ALL a question of capacity for me so I did a packing test-run.I’m a slim shorter guy (small shirts, 29/30 pants, size 7 shoes) so judge accordingly about quantities. But as per photo attached, I determined the max I can bring as: 8-10 tees/polos, 6-7 button-up shirts, 1 light sweater, 4-5 shorts/swim trunks, 4-5 pants, 1 blazer, 2 jackets, 3 belts, 10 underwear, 12 socks, 2 pairs of shoes and 1 pair of sandals. That includes what I wear on the plane (jeans, tee, sweater, jacket, 1 of the pairs of shoes). But everything else went in the suitcase, along with sunglasses, lint roller and electric razor…and that is NOT expanded. That’s up to 18 tops…and therefore 18 outfits, making Carry-On only a totally realistic option for ANY length of trip, especially if you had a Vrbo or Airbnb with laundry. I will add a third pair of shoes in my small daypack “personal item” along with my toiletries and electronics.So it had surprising capacity and was still very lightweight when full. The right hand side that has the handle beneath has less space kind of in 3 little channels, so pack accordingly with shoes etc slotted in between.The Maxlite Air 21” was below all the carry on dimensions for all airlines I checked and I looked at pretty much all the Canadian, American, and European carriers, including discount ones like Easyjet and Ryanair.I’m officially converted to traveling light…and the TravelPro seems to be the perfect fit to make it a more comfortable walk through airports or along city streets. Again will update after my first trip…but hope the above info is useful for anyone who (like me) was very hesitant to ditch the checked luggage.

As someone who has previously used the Travelpro Maxlite soft case, I appreciate the convenience of an external pocket for quick access to items. However, I recently switched to the Travelpro Maxlite Air Hardside 21" carry-on and have found that the hard-shell design offers more structure and protection for my belongings during travel. While it doesn't have an external pocket, the interior organization system is well-designed and maximizes packing space. Overall, I am pleased with my decision to upgrade to the Maxlite Air Hardside and would recommend it to other travelers in need of a reliable and structured suitcase.

Replacing a larger suitcase that travelled the world. This is smaller, more easily manageable. Appreciate the more robust zipper and TSA-compatible locks. Lightweight but sturdy. Well designed and engineered.
